column3: @laanwj Thanks for the quick review! This PR is now limited to fixing the two uninitialized values in `src/bench/checkblock.cpp`.
Uninitialized values are fine if they are not read?\n
@MarcoFalke it looks like these are read, however (well, copied and never acted on, but still technically undefined behavior).\n\nutACK 218d915445b5936c2de1ffe1e2c97b3f3d20becc
Adding link to ["Always initialize an object" (ES.20)](https://github.com/isocpp/CppCoreGuidelines/blob/master/CppCoreGuidelines.md#es20-always-initialize-an-object) in the C++ Core Guidelines.
A NUL terminator is unnecessary here, as the array is not interpreted as a string.
